name: Do not use MONMSG CPF0000 without EXEC  (CL400)
description: This rule searches for CL400 artefact which use the MONMSG with CPF0000 without EXEC.
output:
This report lists all CL400 artefact that use CPF0000 without EXEC.It provides following information:
- CL400 artifact full name
rationale: Checking this generic message will catch all associated exceptions. Then, not using the subsequent EXEC command would mean no action will be performed when an error occurs.
remediation: If CPF0000 is used, specific action must be performed through the EXEC command.
remediationSample:
MONMSG without EXEC Sample Code:

READLOOP: RCVF /* Read a file record */ 
MONMSG MSGID(CPF0864) EXEC(GOTO CMDLBL(EOF)) 
/* Process the file record */ 
GOTO CMDLBL(READLOOP) /* Get another record */ 
EOF: /* End of file processing */
sample:
Using EXEC with the MONMSG command makes the failed CLProgram to do the recovery action mentioned in the EXEC Command. If the EXEC command is not included, then program behaviour will be uncontrolled.

MONMSG without EXEC Sample Code:
READLOOP: RCVF /* Read a file record */
MONMSG MSGID(CPF0864) 
/* Process the file record */ 
GOTO CMDLBL(READLOOP) /* Get another record */ 
EOF: /* End of file processing */
